title: Kristi Noem
deleted: Noem has received 26 traffic citations, including 20 [[Speeding ticket|speeding tickets]] from 1989 to 2010,<ref>{{Cite news |last=Yingling |first=Jennifer |date=August 27, 2010 |title='Please pull over': GOP candidate has 26 traffic violations |url=https://thehill.com/blogs/in-the-know/in-the-know/254343-please-pull-over-gop-candidate-has-26-traffic-violations |access-date=November 16, 2020 |newspaper=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]] |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193332/https://thehill.com/blogs/in-the-know/in-the-know/254343-please-pull-over-gop-candidate-has-26-traffic-violations |url-status=live}}</ref> stop sign and seat belt violations, no driver's license, [[failure to appear]] notices, and two [[Arrest warrant|arrest warrants]]. She has said, "I'm not proud of my driving record, but [I've] been working hard to be a better example to young kids and young drivers out there." She has paid her fines and penalties.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Woster |first=Kevin |title=Life in the too-fast lane: Noem traffic shows long list of tickets |url=https://rapidcityjournal.com/news/life-in-the-too-fast-lane-noem-traffic-shows-long-list-of-tickets/article_5fdda8ca-b18a-11df-8518-001cc4c002e0.html |date=August 27, 2010 |access-date=November 16, 2020 |website=[[Rapid City Journal]] |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193323/https://rapidcityjournal.com/news/life-in-the-too-fast-lane-noem-traffic-shows-long-list-of-tickets/article_5fdda8ca-b18a-11df-8518-001cc4c002e0.html |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Noem's driving record takes wheel of campaign|url=https://www.mitchellrepublic.com/news/government-and-politics/1528437-noems-driving-record-takes-wheel-campaign|access-date=November 16, 2020|website=The Mitchell Republic|archive-date=November 16, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193422/https://www.mitchellrepublic.com/news/government-and-politics/1528437-noems-driving-record-takes-wheel-campaign|url-status=live}}</ref>

title: Kristi Noem
added: In February 2021, Noem signed a bill limiting civil liability for certain exposures to COVID-19.  The bill exempted health care providers and other businesses to include those selling personal protective equipment from lawsuits unless COVID-19 exposure was the result of gross negligence, recklessness, or willful misconduct.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Nelson |first1=Darsha |title=Noem signs bill limiting liability for certain COVID-19 exposures |url=https://www.newscenter1.tv/noem-signs-bill-limiting-liability-for-certain-covid-19-exposures/ |website=Newscenter1 |access-date=22 February 2021}}</ref>

title: Kristi Noem
added: In February 2021, Noem signed a bill limiting civil liability for certain exposures to COVID-19.  The bill exempted health care providers and other businesses to include those selling personal protective equipment from lawsuits unless COVID-19 exposure was the result of gross negligence, recklessness, or willful misconduct.<ref>{{citenews|last1=Nelson |first1=Darsha |title=Noem signs bill limiting liability for certain COVID-19 exposures |url=https://www.newscenter1.tv/noem-signs-bill-limiting-liability-for-certain-covid-19-exposures/ |website=[[KNBN|KNBN NewsCenter1]]|access-date=22 February2021 |date=February 17,2021}}</ref>

title: Kristi Noem
deleted: Noem did not mandate social distancing or the [[Face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic|wearing of face masks]] at a July 3 event at [[Mount Rushmore]] that featured Trump. Health experts warned that large gatherings without social distancing or mask-wearing posed a risk to public health.<ref name="auto">{{Cite news |last=Cummings |first=William |title='We won't be social distancing' at Mount Rushmore celebration with Trump, says SD Gov. Noem |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2020/07/01/kristi-noem-social-distancing-mount-rushmore-trump/5354257002/ |access-date=July 3, 2020 |newspaper=USA Today |date=July 1, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193236/https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2020/07/01/kristi-noem-social-distancing-mount-rushmore-trump/5354257002/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Noem doubted scientific recommendations on the usefulness of masks in slowing the transmission of COVID-19.<ref name="good">{{Cite news |date=October 22, 2020 |title=Noem says South Dakota is doing 'good' as virus surges |url=https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-health-south-dakota-f967a1a56b798f43ae0d2be971b27b39 |access-date=October 24, 2020 |website=AP News |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193231/https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-health-south-dakota-f967a1a56b798f43ae0d2be971b27b39 |url-status=live}}</ref> In an opinion piece in the ''[[Rapid City Journal]]'', she defended her views, citing analysis by the [[Association of American Physicians and Surgeons]], a group known for promoting pseudoscience.<ref name="good" />
